{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Quality Assurance Officer",
  "description": "At Assets MFB, we offer value-based banking to Nigerians by creating superior value for all our stakeholders with the most effective and sustainable technologies, holding ourselves to the highest professional and ethical standards, and building an enduring transparent institution.

Assets Microfinance bank is a tier-1 deposit mobilization bank providing accessible, reliable and convenient financial services to individuals and businesses across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Unit: Customer Success

Responsibilities


	Monitor and evaluate customer interactions against established quality standards.
	Provide constructive feedback and coaching recommendations to staff.
	Identify training needs and collaborate with training teams for staff development.
	Develop and maintain quality scorecards, checklists, and reporting tools.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, company policies, and service protocols.
	Analyze quality trends and recommend process improvements to enhance customer satisfaction.
	Work closely with customer service management to align QA with organizational goals.
	Identifying errors, gaps, or deviations in customer interactions.
	Using QA metrics, KPIs, and customer feedback to assess service quality


Requirements


	Customer Service Experience: Typically 3 years in customer service or call center roles to understand front-line operations.
	Quality Assurance/Monitoring Experience: 1&ndash;3 years of experience in QA or monitoring customer interactions.
	Experience evaluating calls, chats, or emails for compliance and quality standards.
	Process Improvement: Experience in identifying gaps in service processes and recommending improvements.
	Reporting &amp; Analytics: Experience in generating performance reports, scorecards, and metrics dashboards is a strong requirement.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 Monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talentlinkng@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-04",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-12",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Assets Microfinance Bank"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",

       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "name": "",
    "value": "189826"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 250000,
      "maxValue": 400000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }

}



Quality Assurance Officer Job at Assets Microfinance Bank




        
    

        
        At Assets MFB, we offer value-based banking to Nigerians by creating superior value for all our stakeholders with the most effective and sustainable technologies, holding ourselves to the highest professional and ethical standards, and building an enduring transparent institution.

Assets Microfinance bank is a tier-1 deposit mobilization bank providing accessible, reliable and convenient financial services to individuals and businesses across Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Unit: Customer Success

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Monitor and evaluate customer interactions against established quality standards.
	Provide constructive feedback and coaching recommendations to staff.
	Identify training needs and collaborate with training teams for staff development.
	Develop and maintain quality scorecards, checklists, and reporting tools.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, company policies, and service protocols.
	Analyze quality trends and recommend process improvements to enhance customer satisfaction.
	Work closely with customer service management to align QA with organizational goals.
	Identifying errors, gaps, or deviations in customer interactions.
	Using QA metrics, KPIs, and customer feedback to assess service quality


Requirements


	Customer Service Experience: Typically 3 years in customer service or call center roles to understand front-line operations.
	Quality Assurance/Monitoring Experience: 1–3 years of experience in QA or monitoring customer interactions.
	Experience evaluating calls, chats, or emails for compliance and quality standards.
	Process Improvement: Experience in identifying gaps in service processes and recommending improvements.
	Reporting & Analytics: Experience in generating performance reports, scorecards, and metrics dashboards is a strong requirement.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentlinkng@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Officer",
  "description": "Lead for Good Africa is a Leadership Development and Skill Empowerment Social Enterprise. Our vision at Lead For Good Africa is to eradicate poverty and improve human capital development on the African continent through leadership development and skill empowerment programs geared towards increasing productivity and providing opportuinites for economic advancement for youths and women in underserved communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Account Officer

Job Location: Nigeria

Description


	The Finance and Admin Officer will be responsible for managing financial transactions, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring compliance with organizational policies and donor requirements and will also provide administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of the office.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare monthend closure reports, bank resolutions, etc. from the accounting software.
	Participate in audit exercise.
	Coordinate the timely payment of statutory deductions of PAYE, WHT, and other taxes.
	Provide support with the accounting workflow in the review and audit of the organization.
	Prepare financial reports to monitor and track obligations and expenditures.
	Participate actively by assisting in project budget development.&nbsp;
	Provide support to the technical team in monitoring subproject budgets.&nbsp;
	Ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations and reporting standards.
	Oversee the daily administrative functions of the office to ensure smooth operations.
	Coordinate procurement processes, including vendor selection, purchase orders, and contract management, ensuring compliance with procurement policies.
	Support the organization of meetings, training sessions, and workshops, providing logistical and administrative support.
	Maintain an organized filing system for financial and administrative records, ensuring accessibility and confidentiality.


Education and/or Work Experience Requirements


	BSc Degree in Accounting, Finance and Investment.
	Professional certification in a relevant field of expertise is an added advantage.
	Proven work experience of at least (2 - 4) years.


Desired Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of financial management principles and practices.
	Excellent organizational skills.
	Strong analytical skills.
	Attention to detail.
	Good communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	Proficiency in accounting software.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "name": "Lead For Good Africa"
    
  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

}



Account Officer Job at Lead for Good Africa




        
    

        
        Lead for Good Africa is a Leadership Development and Skill Empowerment Social Enterprise. Our vision at Lead For Good Africa is to eradicate poverty and improve human capital development on the African continent through leadership development and skill empowerment programs geared towards increasing productivity and providing opportuinites for economic advancement for youths and women in underserved communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Nigeria

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Finance and Admin Officer will be responsible for managing financial transactions, maintaining accurate records, and ensuring compliance with organizational policies and donor requirements and will also provide administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of the office.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare monthend closure reports, bank resolutions, etc. from the accounting software.
	Participate in audit exercise.
	Coordinate the timely payment of statutory deductions of PAYE, WHT, and other taxes.
	Provide support with the accounting workflow in the review and audit of the organization.
	Prepare financial reports to monitor and track obligations and expenditures.
	Participate actively by assisting in project budget development. 
	Provide support to the technical team in monitoring subproject budgets. 
	Ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations and reporting standards.
	Oversee the daily administrative functions of the office to ensure smooth operations.
	Coordinate procurement processes, including vendor selection, purchase orders, and contract management, ensuring compliance with procurement policies.
	Support the organization of meetings, training sessions, and workshops, providing logistical and administrative support.
	Maintain an organized filing system for financial and administrative records, ensuring accessibility and confidentiality.


Education and/or Work Experience Requirements


	BSc Degree in Accounting, Finance and Investment.
	Professional certification in a relevant field of expertise is an added advantage.
	Proven work experience of at least (2 - 4) years.


Desired Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of financial management principles and practices.
	Excellent organizational skills.
	Strong analytical skills.
	Attention to detail.
	Good communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	Proficiency in accounting software.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Frontend Developer",
  "description": "Trusoft Limited is a custom-services software company, specializing in the design and development of software solutions. We have built our brand around creating solutions adapted to the local market, but competing in quality in the international markets. Our products and services cut across the Educational, Medical, and Financial sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications and experience.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;digital.talents@trusoft.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  },

Frontend Developer Job at Trusoft Limited




        
    

        
        Trusoft Limited is a custom-services software company, specializing in the design and development of software solutions. We have built our brand around creating solutions adapted to the local market, but competing in quality in the international markets. Our products and services cut across the Educational, Medical, and Financial sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Requirements
